application.doc: Retrieve the number of outstanding changes

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieve the number of outstanding changes
method.doc: The LMI uses a two-stage commit process when you make changes to the appliance.
Stage 1: Changes are made by using the LMI and saved to a staging area.
Stage 2: The user explicitly deploys the changes into production.
Multiple changes can exist in a pending state at the same time. They are committed or rolled back together when a user deploys or rolls back these changes.
To retrieve a count of the number of changes which are in a pending state, issue an HTTP GET command on the Verify Identity Access pending changes count resource URI.
